metadata.title: Northwest Pacific Moored Sediment Trap Data - Russian Collaboration, 1991-1992
metadata.description: Time series data from 3 moored sediment traps deployed in the NW Pacific Ocean in 1991-1992 at 4000-5000m.  Collaborative data collected on Russian vessels.
keywords: Earth Science > Oceans > Ocean Chemistry > Biogeochemical Cycles
Earth Science > Oceans > Marine Sediments > Sediment Compostion
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Biogeochemical flux in the deep ocean.

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre.
Risk of Loss: High
Impact Justification: Does not affect a wide variety of users.
Impact of Loss: Low
Recommended Action: Bring data to archives.
Additional Info: See also entry under, Northwest Pacific, 1991-1992 (GEMS); data from cruises to deploy and retrieve sediment traps.
Four sediment traps were deployed; one did not work.

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: Private

Use constraints: Data not yet published, collaborative.

Distribution liability: [unknown]

FGDC metadata date: 20080211

FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

FGDC metadata version: FGDC-STD-1998-1

Native data set environment: Expected Growth Rate: N/A

Data quality - Logical consistency: For C:N, biogenic silicate, CaCO3: subsamples of one sample, collected at P26, are analyzed with each set of data to check for continuity.  Zooplankton that likely swam into the trap are removed. Silicate concentrations are compared to prepared standards.
Data quality - Completeness: Electronic Data Complications: Lotus 1-2-3 spreadsheets should be converted to Excel
Lineage - Process steps:
  1. IOS and POI (Vladivostok)

Distribution liability: [unknown]
Non-digital ordering: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y
Hardcopy Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1408, IOS
Hardcopy Description: Binder of data sheets
Hardcopy Volume: one 1 in. binder
Physical Sample Exists: Y
Physical Sample Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1411, IOS
Physical Sample Volume: about one hundred.
Physical Sample Description: Vials of dried sediment in various formats: some are on filters, some are not.
Fees: Ask Custodian
